html:
ALWAYS REMEMBER 'RULE NO. 3'

CBSâ€™ Young NCIS Announcement Wins April Foolâ€™s Day â€” View the Kiddie Cast

April 1 is always a good day to remember Gibbsâ€™ Rule No. 3: â€œDonâ€™t believe what you are told; double-check.â€

There are still a few hours left for this April Foolâ€™s Day, but I feel confident in declaring the â€œwinnerâ€ (among teasing TV shows and stars) to be the announcement that Young NCIS is â€œcoming soon to CBS.â€

The goof came complete with a cast reveal of kiddos that correspond to current NCIS cast members Diona Reasonover, Katrina Law, Sean Murray, Gary Cole, Wilmer Valderrama, Rocky Carroll and Brian Dietzen.

â€œThis fall, thereâ€™s no case too small,â€ the official NCISverse Instagram account announced. â€œ#YoungNCIS is coming soon to a TV near you.ğŸ‘ğŸ§’ â€

And lest there be any doubt that this prequel spinoff was faux, confirmation was found in the accompany hashtags: â€œ#NewSeries #NCIS #NCISverse #AprilFools #TV #YoungSheldon #WhatToWatchâ€

Among the actual NCIS cast who weighed in on the online prank, Law commented, â€œI 100% believedâ€ in the Instagram reveal, while Reasonover replied with an apt, â€œOmg.â€

The still-active Instagram account for Young Sheldon, the clear inspiration for Young NCIS (font and all), meanwhile inquired, â€œAre you casting? ğŸ‘€â€

Placing a distant second to Young NCIS was Shark Tank vet Barbara Corcoranâ€™s Tuesday-morning sharing of the â€œBIG NEWSâ€ that she had gone in for her fourth career facelift, to â€œlook 25 again,â€ and â€œboy was it worth it.â€

Which pop culture-related April Foolâ€™s Day prank earned high marks in your book?
